item.title: Commercial waste ripped open by foxes, 10th January

…leaving rubbish all over the pavement. Disgusting corner as it is every single day!!!!

item.title: Dumped rubbish left here for a long period of time, 10th January
item.description:
There is starting to be a build up of rubbish being left by some lovely locals that needs cleaning up ASAP. It’s been here for weeks. Installing a public bin here would be really useful. Thank you so much.

item.title: There is a large rock in the road, the size of a large brick but it’s an actual rock, 10th January
item.description:
It’s google maps co ordinates (51.5579846, 0.0632549) There is a rock on the right hand lane exit for Ilford where it is 50mph going down to 30mph, it nearly made me lose control of my vehicle as it was grey colour I only saw it when I approached it.

item.title: Litter and food waste outside Rise & Bloom/ Nisa on Barry a road, 10th January
item.description:
Constantly filthy outside these businesses. Please can you clean up the litter that is there and consider adding a waste bin? There aren’t any bins near the bus stops or the cafe/shop. Barry road is very busy and needs more frequent cleaning.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 25, Barry Road, East Dulwich, Greater London

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Evelina Road, Penge, Greater London

item.title: Towpath entrance opposite St Mark’s Church on Prince Albert Road, 10th January
item.description:
There has been a significant drop in two sections of paving near entrance to the ramp leading down to the towpath. This has created a serious trip hazard and has rendered the ramp unusable for people with accessibility needs, including wheelchair users. The issue is located at the towpath entrance opposite St Mark’s Church on Prince Albert Road. The uneven paving is immediately adjacent to a set of steps, meaning that anyone who stumbles is at risk of falling down the steps and sustaining serious injury. This is a key access point, and its current condition presents an unacceptable safety and accessibility risk. Urgent repairs are required to reinstate a safe, level surface and restore proper access as soon as possible. If you are not the appropriate contact to action this, please forward this report to the relevant team or individual responsible and confirm who it has been passed to.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Prince Albert Road Ramp, Chalk Farm, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tenporary traffic lights on Crown Lane are stuck on red, 10th January
item.description:
This is causing long tailbacks and people going through red lights which is dangerous.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Crown Lane, Southborough, Greater London

item.category: Utility Works and Temporary Traffic Lights

item.title: Dog poo, 10th January
item.description:
Third case in same location in 24 hours. I cleaned the other two up as on the pavement directly outside my house (I have two small children who would just walk in it). Please can you do something to help stop this?

item.title: Litter pick required, 10th January
item.description:
Could you please litter pick this area - it really needs some time spent on it. It has not been looked after in the last 4 years. Litter, newspapers and bottles (glass and plastic) everywhere. This also seems to be a dropping point for ‘strange’ bags by suspicious individuals. This was first raised on 4 February 2024 but nothing has been done despite the council closing the ticket and stating it is ‘fixed’- which it is not.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Mulgrave Road, Woolwich
Report on FixMyStreet

Please take them away

item.title: Fly tipping and pavement obstruction, 10th January
item.description:
Large items of waste and loose rubbish have been left on the pavement and roadside outside this address for around three weeks. The waste is blocking the pavement, making it difficult and unsafe to pass, especially when pushing a pram, often forcing pedestrians into the road. This appears to be an ongoing issue, with rubbish regularly left outside the property, leaving the street looking neglected and unsightly. Please arrange removal and investigate if appropriate, as this poses a safety risk and affects the local environment.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Manton Road, Abbey Wood
Report on FixMyStreet
